problem_text:
An infinite group, all of whose proper subgroups are finite, is called quasi-finite. Is it true that an element of a quasi-finite group G is central if and only if it is contained in infinitely many subgroups of G?
V. P. Shunkov
answer: No (K. I. Lossov, Dep. no. 5529-V89, VINITI, Moscow, 1988 (Russian)).
